Text: I have decided that I will upload the movie in either DVD5 or DVD9 solely to my discretion. If the movies quality will fall short of 80% from compression with new releases I will leave as DVD9. If under 70% for older releases I will leave as DVD9. I think this is a reasonable conclusion to try and please all of my followers. Please enjoy and always feel free to tell me how much you like the movie:)
Thanx ;)

Hey sorry about no seeds today everyone for some reason I didn't realize my utorrent was closed and I just got in from work. I have thought about it long and hard but I'm going to stick with what I am doing. I may upload the odd DVD9 but for the most part the majority of people are looking for the best quality DVD5 and I can provide that to them so I'm sorry if anyone is disappointed about not very many DVD9's but this is the way I'm going to roll if you wanna continue following me thank you so much for your support and if not well your loss.
Also Zombie it's impossible to make a DVD9 to a DVD5 without compressing the feature.

@MM: not necessarily, if you re-encode everything else but the main feature on a dvd9 that is perhaps like your previous torrent, then i would say it has to be possible...im definitely not taking a shot at ya but to me it makes sense...i really hope that a**hole in your last torrent doesnt see this bc it will just get him going again...thanks for this by the way, since i dont think i thanked ya yet

Oh no worries and even though the book of eli was only 4.9 I still had to compress it by 12% so that is technically a quality loss is what I'm saying. It's pretty much impossible to dvd 9 to a dvd5 without getting rid of extras because the movies features are usually like 4.7GB + and then once you add all the padding it will be like 5GB so it wouldn't fit on a disk. So in my opinon are you really going to noticed 12% compression most likely no lol. So yeah. I know you guys aren't shooting me down but technically there is somewhat of a quality loss when re-encoding.
Oh you mean the comments??? I uno someone wanted a DVD9 when there was only 12% compression to the feature film so yeah lol.
